New Records: Jose Quintana pitched 11 innings in two clinching games this postseason and allowed zero earned runs.
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a go-ahead grand slam in the sixth inning to propel the Mets past the rival Phillies, 4-1, capturing the NLDS in four games.
Edwin Diaz struck out Kyle Schwarber to advance to the NLCS for the first time in nine years.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets may need to take a break from the beer and bubbly to keep an eye on the remaining NLDS series between the Padres and Dodgers.
Post-Match Reflections: This Mets team just has it. A well deserved series win over Philadelphia came from a blend of strong pitching and clutch hitting.
This is one of the best team's in Major League Baseball and they showed that yet again in the Phillies series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pete Alonso danced on a table in the Mets wild postgame celebrations.
The Mets will face either the Padres or Dodgers in the next round.
